Package matchle

Class GameLogic

java.lang.Object
matchle.GameLogic
public class GameLogic extends Object
Shared game logic for the Matchle word guessing game. This class contains the core game mechanics and state management, and is designed to be used by both console and GUI versions of the game. The primary responsibilities include: - Managing the game state (corpus, secret key, filters) - Processing guesses and generating feedback - Determining game termination conditions - Suggesting optimal guesses

  • Constructor Details

    • GameLogic

      public GameLogic()

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(Corpus corpus, NGram secretKey)
      Initializes a new game with the specified corpus and secret key. This method sets up the initial game state with a predefined secret key.
      Parameters:
      corpus - The corpus of words to use for the game
      secretKey - The predefined secret key to use

    • initialize

      public void initialize(Corpus corpus)
      Initializes a new game with the specified corpus and a randomly selected secret key. This method sets up the initial game state by choosing a random word from the corpus.
      Parameters:
      corpus - The corpus of words to use for the game

    • createDefaultCorpus

      public Corpus createDefaultCorpus()
      Creates a default corpus of words when none is provided or loading fails. This provides a fallback set of words to ensure the game can still function.
      Returns:
      A Corpus containing a default set of words

    • isCorrectGuess

      public boolean isCorrectGuess(NGram guess)
      Checks if the provided guess matches the secret key.
      Parameters:
      guess - The guess to check against the secret key
      Returns:
      true if the guess is correct, false otherwise

    • processGuess

      public Filter processGuess(NGram guess)
      Processes a guess and updates the game state accordingly. This method generates a filter based on the guess, updates the accumulated filter, and filters the candidate corpus.
      Parameters:
      guess - The guess to process
      Returns:
      The Filter generated for this round of guessing

    • generateRoundFilter

      public Filter generateRoundFilter(NGram guess)
      Generates a filter by comparing a guess against the secret key. The filter represents the pattern of matches between the guess and the key.
      Parameters:
      guess - The guess to compare against the secret key
      Returns:
      A Filter representing the pattern of matches

    • getBestGuess

      public NGram getBestGuess()
      Gets the best possible guess from the current candidate corpus. This uses the corpus's algorithm to determine the optimal guess that will provide the most information.
      Returns:
      The NGram representing the best guess

    • hasGameTerminated

      public boolean hasGameTerminated()
      Checks if the game has terminated by testing ending conditions. The game is considered terminated if there are zero or one candidates remaining.
      Returns:
      true if the game has ended, false otherwise

    • getSecretKey

      public NGram getSecretKey()
      Gets the secret key that players are trying to guess.
      Returns:
      The NGram representing the secret key

    • getCandidateCorpus

      public Corpus getCandidateCorpus()
      Gets the current candidate corpus containing all possible words that match the accumulated filter.
      Returns:
      The Corpus of candidate words

    • getAccumulatedFilter

      public Filter getAccumulatedFilter()
      Gets the accumulated filter from all rounds played so far.
      Returns:
      The accumulated Filter object

    • loadState

      public void loadState(GameState state)
      Loads a saved game state into this GameLogic instance. This replaces the current game state with the provided saved state.
      Parameters:
      state - The GameState to load

    • createGameState

      public GameState createGameState()
      Creates a GameState object representing the current state of the game. This can be used for saving the game state.
      Returns:
      A new GameState object containing the current game state
